about_the_game:
What Is the Game About:

In recent weeks, the once peaceful of Oak City have turned into the hunting grounds of a merciless predator, leaving behind a trail of fear and death. Authorities urgently advise residents to stay indoors after dark. Remember: Do not go out at night!



This is an immersive puzzle adventure that will test your wits and courage. As you navigate through the enigmatic and eerie atmosphere of a company in the Oak City, you must solve intricate puzzles and unlock chained escape rooms to survive. Each room presents a unique challenge, requiring keen observation and clever solutions to advance.

This four chapters journey will take you through dark office, sequential rooms and hidden underground passages, each shrouded in mystery and danger. The deeper you delve, the closer you come to uncovering the full extent of the predator’s evil scheme. Will you uncover the truth and escape the shadows of Oak City, or will you become the next victim of the night? The fate of Oak City rests in your hands.

Designer's Comment:


As an indie game designer, creating this game has been a deeply personal and rewarding journey. The idea for this game was inspired by classic thriller movies which captivated me with their intense atmospheres and intricate plot twists. One of the most memorable moments during development was designing the sequential escape rooms. Each room had to be unique, challenging, and seamlessly integrated into the story. I spent countless nights perfecting the mechanics to ensure that players would feel a true sense of accomplishment with every puzzle solved. I hope you enjoy playing this game as much as I enjoyed creating it. Thank you for your support, and happy gaming!

Key Features:

  • Special Puzzle Mechanics
  • Sequential Escape Rooms
  • Thought-provoking plot

This game is created by @Ning with YAHAHA Horror Game Kit and YAHAHA assists the creator with packaging and publishing the game based on their request. Yahaha Horror Gamekit is tailored for imaginative creators and players who adore horror games, all without the need for any programming expertise.
